@description.name: @description
@description.body: AbstractRenderer is an abstract class used to encapsulate behaviours of how a form can be rendered into a mobile page. Its subclasses can extend it and override {@link #addItems} and {@link #addButton} methods in order to customize the way the form gets into the DOM.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: form {qx.ui.mobile.form.Form} The form to be rendered

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler responsible for updating the rendered widget as soon as the form changes.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Renders the for: adds the items and buttons.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: interface implementation

@description.name: @description
@description.body: interface implementation

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Shows an error to the user when a form element is in invalid state usually it prints an error message, so that user can rectify the filling of the form element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the errors for the form by removing any error messages inserted into DOM in the case of invalid form elements

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
